info.title: Crypto Ramp API
info.description:
[Revolut Ramp web app](https://ramp.revolut.com/) allows Revolut customers and non-Revolut users to buy crypto using fiat money, where the crypto is issued to the desired address on blockchain.
It can also be used as an embeddable widget for integrating with Revolut Partners (crypto exchanges, wallets, NFT-marketplaces etc.)

In addition to the web app, we provide this Crypto Ramp API.
The API endpoints are organised into thematic groups and let you leverage the following features:
- [Partners](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/crypto-ramp/partners) - poll different exchange rates, display them on your website and compare with other providers
- [Webhooks](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/crypto-ramp/webhooks) - track order and payment lifecycle with webhooks

For more information, see the guides: [Leverage the Crypto Ramp API](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/use-the-api) and [Work with Webhooks -> Track order and payment lifecycle](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/work-with-webhooks/use-webhooks)

tags.name: Partners
tags.description:
The **Partners** endpoints let you poll different exchange rates, display them on your website and compare them with other providers.

For more details, see the guides: [Leverage the Crypto Ramp API](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/use-the-api).

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description:
A webhook (also called a web callback) allows your system to receive an event from Ramp immediately after it happens.
With the **Webhooks** endpoints, you can create, update, delete, and retrieve webhooks, as well as retrieve webhooks that you have created.

For more details, see the guides: [Work with Webhooks -> Track order and payment lifecycle](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/work-with-webhooks/use-webhooks) and [-> Verify the payload signature](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/work-with-webhooks/verify-the-payload-signature).

get.description:
Retrieve Revolut Ramp configuration, such as available fiat currencies and crypto tokens with corresponding limits and supported countries.

For more information, see the guides: [Leverage the Crypto Ramp API -> Get your configuration details](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/use-the-api#get-your-configuration-details).

Retrieve an order quote representing current exchange rate, total crypto amount and fees.
Use it to display potential exchange rate to your customer.

For more information, see the guides: [Leverage the Crypto Ramp API -> Get an order quote](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/use-the-api#get-an-order-quote).

parameters.name: fiat
parameters.description: The [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) code of the selected fiat currency to use for the purchase.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The fiat amount to exchange for crypto.

parameters.name: crypto
parameters.description: The ID of the crypto token to purchase, obtained from the [`/config`](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/crypto-ramp/retrieve-configuration) endpoint.

parameters.name: payment
parameters.description: The selected [payment option](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/introduction-to-revolut-ramp/coverage-and-other-details/payment-options).

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: The [ISO 3166 Alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) code of the country of residence of the customer (end user) ordering the exchange.

parameters.name: feePercentage
parameters.description: The fee percentage that will be applied for the order as partner fee.

parameters.name: walletAddress
parameters.description: The address of the crypto wallet into which the purchased token should be transferred.

get.description:
Retrieve a redirect URL to the Ramp app widget for provided buy parameters. Use it to redirect the customer to Revolut Ramp to make the purchase.

:::note
The `fiatAmount` in the Redirect URL is provided in minor currency units. For example, GBP 12.00 is represented as `1200`.
:::

For more information, see the guides: [Leverage the Crypto Ramp API -> Get a Revolut Ramp Redirect URL](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/use-the-api#get-a-revolut-ramp-redirect-url).

parameters.name: fiat
parameters.description: The [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) code of the selected fiat currency to use for the purchase.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The fiat amount to exchange for crypto.

parameters.name: crypto
parameters.description: The ID of the crypto token to purchase, obtained from the [`/config`](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/crypto-ramp/retrieve-configuration) endpoint.

parameters.name: payment
parameters.description: The selected [payment option](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/introduction-to-revolut-ramp/coverage-and-other-details/payment-options).

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: The [ISO 3166 Alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) code of the country of residence of the customer (end user) ordering the exchange.

parameters.name: wallet
parameters.description: The address of the crypto wallet into which to transfer the purchased token.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description:
The external identifier of the order to be made.
Should be either UUID or ULID.

parameters.name: feePercentage
parameters.description: The fee percentage that will be applied for the order as partner fee.

parameters.name: partnerRedirectUrl
parameters.description: The URL to which to redirect the customer after the purchase – for example, your website. If not provided, the customer is shown transaction result in Revolut Ramp.

parameters.name: additionalProperties
parameters.description:
A prefix that allows passing arbitrary key-value pairs. 
For each pair, the prefix and key should be separated by `.`.

If such additional properties are provided, when you call the [`/orders`](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/crypto-ramp/retrieve-all-orders) endpoint, they are returned along with the order details.

200.description:
The requested redirect URL

:::note
The `fiatAmount` in the Redirect URL is provided in minor currency units. For example, GBP 12.00 is represented as `1200`.
:::

get.description:
Retrieve an order by `order_id` provided in the path and the `wallet` address provided as a query parameter.

For more information, see the guides: [Leverage the Crypto Ramp API -> Get an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/use-the-api#get-an-order).

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description:
The external identifier of the order to retrieve.
Should be either UUID or ULID.

parameters.name: wallet
parameters.description: The address of the crypto wallet into which the token transfer was ordered.

get.description:
Retrieve all orders by date range.

The results are sorted chronologically by the `created_at` date (i.e. oldest first).

For more information, see the guides: [Leverage the Crypto Ramp API -> Get all orders](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/use-the-api#get-all-orders).

parameters.name: start
parameters.description:
The earliest date for the order creation date range (inclusive) in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

In other words, the "oldest" order creation date you are interested in.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description:
The latest date for the order creation date range (inclusive) in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

In other words, the "most recent" order creation date you are interested in.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description:
The number of orders to skip at the beginning of the range when fetching orders (sorted by creation date, oldest first).

This means that if you set `skip=3`, the first three orders are skipped, and the list of orders that you get as a result will start with the order that would normally be 4th on the list.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
The maximum number of orders to fetch from the given range.
Must be between `1` and `1000` (inclusive).
Default value is `100`.

get.description:
Get the details of a specific webhook.

For more information, see the guides: [Work with webhooks -> Track order and payment lifecycle](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/work-with-webhooks/use-webhooks).

parameters.name: webhook_id
parameters.description: The ID of the webhook.

patch.description:
Update the details of a specific webhook.

For more information, see the guides: [Work with webhooks -> Track order and payment lifecycle](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/work-with-webhooks/use-webhooks).

parameters.name: webhook_id
parameters.description: The ID of the webhook.

delete.description:
Delete a webhook so that events are not sent to the specified URL any more.

For more information, see the guides: [Work with webhooks -> Track order and payment lifecycle](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/work-with-webhooks/use-webhooks).

parameters.name: webhook_id
parameters.description: The ID of the webhook.

get.description:
Get a list of webhooks that the partner is currently subscribed to.

For more information, see the guides: [Work with webhooks -> Track order and payment lifecycle](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/work-with-webhooks/use-webhooks).

200.description: The list of all your existing webhooks

post.description:
Create a webhook so that Ramp can push event notifications to the specified URL.

For more information, see the guides: [Work with webhooks -> Track order and payment lifecycle](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/work-with-webhooks/use-webhooks).

AccessToken.name: X-API-KEY
AccessToken.description:
Each Crypto Ramp API request must contain an authorization header in the following format to make a call: `X-API-KEY: {your_API_key}`. 

Before you start, make sure that you have the correct API key. For more information, see the **Get started** guides: [Integrate with Revolut Ramp -> 2. Get Partner keys](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/buy-crypto/get-started#2-get-partner-keys).

XApiKey.name: X-API-KEY
XApiKey.description:
Your API key that you received during integration setup. 
For more information, see the **Authorization** section above.

countries.description: The list of client countries supported by Ramp – for your customer to be able to use Revolut Ramp, they must be resident in one of those countries.

fiat.description: The supported fiat currencies and limits.

items.description: The supported fiat currency and limits.

currency.description: The [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) code of the supported currency.

crypto.description: The list of cryptocurrencies supported by Revolut Ramp.

id.description:
The unique identifier of the crypto currency-blockchain pair.
Should be used throughout the API to reference the specific crypto.

smartContractAddress.description: The smart contract address. Returned only for tokens.

feePercentages.description: The list of fee percentages that can be applied for the order as partner fee.

payment_methods.description: The list of available payment methods.

CurrencyCryptoId.description: The ID of the currency, obtained from the [`/config`](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/crypto-ramp/retrieve-configuration) endpoint.

id.description: The external UUID of the order.

fiat.description: The fiat amount that the customer paid for the crypto (excluding fees).

crypto.description: The crypto amount that the customer received.

exchange_rate.description: The exchange rate for the order.

created_at.description: The UTC date and time of order creation in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

updated_at.description: The UTC date and time of order update in the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

fail_reason.description: The reason why the order failed.

wallet.description: The address of the crypto wallet into which the crypto transfer was ordered.

transaction_hash.description:
The blockchain transaction hash.
Absent if no crypto transaction has been created yet.
Always present if order is in the `COMPLETED` state.

additionalProperties.description: The additional properties passed in the call to the [`/buy`](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/crypto-ramp/retrieve-a-redirect-url) endpoint under the `additionalProperties.*` query parameter(s), if such properties were provided.

fees_partner_currency.description: The fees converted to the partner's currency.

Quote.description: The exchange price between fiat and crypto currencies (including fees).

service_fee.description:
The sum of Revolut Ramp fee and Partner fee.

:::note
The Partner fee is also provided separately in the `partner_fee` parameter.
:::

crypto.description: Crypto amount that the customer receives in the case of a successful exchange.

partner_fee.description:
Partner fee.

:::note
This Partner fee is also included in the `service_fee` value, which represents the total sum of Partner fee and Revolut Ramp fee.
:::

RampRedirectUrl.description: Redirect URL to Ramp app widget

ramp_redirect_url.description: The URL to Revolut Ramp to which to redirect the customer for the purchase.

url.description:
The webhook's URL to which event notifications will be sent.
Must be a valid HTTP or HTTPS URL, capable of receiving POST requests.

events.description: The list of event types that the webhook is configured to listen to.

signing_secret.description:
The [signing secret](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/work-with-webhooks/verify-the-payload-signature#webhook-signing-secret) for the webhook.
Use it to verify the signature for the webhook's request payload.

url.description:
The webhook's URL to which event notifications will be sent.
Must be a valid HTTP or HTTPS URL, capable of receiving POST requests.

events.description: The list of event types that the webhook is configured to listen to.

url.description:
The webhook's URL to which event notifications will be sent.
Must be a valid HTTP or HTTPS URL, capable of receiving POST requests.

events.description: The list of event types that the webhook is configured to listen to.

BadRequestError.description: Thrown when request parameter field is invalid

message.description: Specifies the invalid parameter that was provided by the user.

NotFoundError.description: Thrown when resource can't be found

message.description: The message displayed to the user when resource cannot be found.

DisabledByKillSwitchError.description: Thrown when endpoint is disabled by Kill Switch.

message.description: The message displayed to the user when endpoint is disabled by Kill Switch.

UnexpectedError.description: Thrown when an unexpected error happens.

errorId.description: The UUID of the unexpected error that has occurred.

timestamp.description: The timestamp of when the error happened.

BadRequestErrorResponse.description:
Bad request

A request parameter is invalid.

DisabledByKillSwitchErrorResponse.description: The endpoint is disabled by Kill Switch

ServerErrorResponse.description:
Server error

An unexpected error occurred.
